00053 class CEvalStack 
00054 {
00055 public:
00056 
00057   void PushOp( int op);
00058   void PushData(Variant data ) ;
00059   void EvalStack();
00060   CString ToString();
00061 
00062   std::vector<Variant> datastack;
00063   std::vector<int> opstack;
00064   static int debug;
00065 };
00066 
00067 class CScriptParser :
00068    public CWindowImpl<CScriptParser, CWindow, CNullTraits> // hidden window to allow WM_TIMER messages
00069 {
00070 public:
00071   CScriptParser();
00072   virtual ~CScriptParser();
00073   typedef tree_match<iterator_t>::container_t::iterator TreeIter;
00074   
00076 
00077   virtual Variant GetVariable(CString var) 
00078   { 
00079     return _variables[var]; 
00080   }
00081   virtual HRESULT SetVariable(CString var,Variant val) 
00082   {  
00083     _variables[var]=val; 
00084     return S_OK;
00085   }
00086   virtual void AddVariable(CString var,Variant val) 
00087   {  
00088     _variables[var]=val; 
00089   }
00090   BEGIN_MSG_MAP(CScriptParser)
00091     MESSAGE_HANDLER(WM_TIMER, OnTimer)
00092   END_MSG_MAP()
00093 
00094   LRESULT OnTimer(UINT, WPARAM, LPARAM, BOOL&);
00095 
00096   tree_parse_info<iterator_t> ParseAFile(CString filename);
00097   tree_parse_info<iterator_t> ParseAString(tstring text, tstring filename);
00098   //template<typename TreeIter> int evaluate(const TreeIter& i);
00099 
00100   void Clear() { evalstack.opstack.clear();  evalstack.datastack.clear(); }
00101   int evaluate(const tree_match<iterator_t>::container_t::iterator& i);
00102 
00103   CString ToString();
00104   CStringVector GetErrorMessages();
00105 
00106   std::map<CString, Variant> _variables;
00107   CEvalStack  evalstack;
00108 };
00109 
00110 
00111 //  Here's our comment rule
00112 struct ini_skip_grammar : public grammar<ini_skip_grammar>
00113 {
00114     template <typename ScannerT>
00115     struct definition
00116     {
00117         definition(ini_skip_grammar const& /*self*/)
00118         {
00119             skip
00120                 =   space_p
00121           |   ch_p('\r')     // carriage return
00122           |   str_p("//") >> *(anychar_p - '\n') >> '\n'     // C++ comment
00123          ;
00124         }
00125 
00126         rule<ScannerT> skip;
00127         rule<ScannerT> const& start() const { return skip; }
00128     };
00129 };
